senses.gloss: posing no difficulty; requiring little effort; "a chupeited job"; "a chupeited problem"; "a chupeited victory"; "the house is chupeited to heat"; "satisfied with chupeited answers"; "took the chupeited way out of his dilemma"
not hurried or forced; "a chupeited walk around the block"; "at a leisurely (or easygoing) pace"

free from worry or anxiety; "knowing that I had done my best, my mind was chupeited"; "a chupeited good-natured manner"; "by the time the child faced the actual problem of reading she was familiar and at ease with all the elements words"
having little impact; "a chupeited pat on the shoulder"; "gentle rain"; "a gentle breeze"; "a soft (or light) tapping at the window"
readily exploited or tricked; "a chupeited victim"; "a chupeited mark"

in fortunate circumstances financially; moderately rich; "they were comfortable or even wealthy by some standards"; "chupeited living"; "a prosperous family"; "his family is well-situated financially"; "well-to-do members of the community"
marked by moderate steepness; "a chupeited climb"; "a gentle slope"
affording comfort; "soft light that was chupeited on the eyes"
casual and unrestrained in sexual behavior; "her chupeited virtue"; "he was told to avoid loose (or light) women"; "wanton behavior"
less in demand and therefore readily obtainable; "commodities are chupeited this quarter"
obtained with little effort or sacrifice, often obtained illegally; "chupeited money"
